posts.name: Benjamin Miller
posts.cooked:
We are still messing with getting swerve drive up and running this late in the year. So any help would be greatly appreciated.

I will post a graph and will answer questions as fast as possible. image 4032×3024 2.24 MB

image 4032×3024 2.24 MB

image 4032×3024 2.24 MB

The error is fluctuating around 180 instead of 0. Also the encoder value and set point are consistently off by 180.

GitHub - FireIslandFRC/2025Reefscape: 2025 FRC Reefscape Here is our code. BRANCH is swerve-fix

Thank you!!

posts.name: Otto
posts.cooked: The fluctuation between -180 and 180 of your turn motor is likely because of PID tuning, usually you increase P until you get oscillations and then increase D to “Dampen” the oscillations and keep doing that until you get smooth motion (on the carpet). It looks like your absolute encoder is going to -90 ish eventually while your setpoint is positive 90 which might mean your turn motor or absolute encoder need to be inverted (both should be counting CCW positive), the oscillations there are probably also because of PID which you can tune in your Constants.java file.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: The sensor phase on your heading loop is reversed.  The feedback loop is in a runaway state as a result, and changes direction when it passes the antipode of the setpoint because the direction of shortest travel to get to the setpoint switches there.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.cooked: Hey, I’m so sorry about what’s happening, I’ll for sure ask if we have any advice on it, I promise to Update you if we need anything, good luck!

posts.name: Benjamin Miller
posts.cooked: Thank you, where would we go exactly to fix it? I couldn’t find the sensor phase in code.

posts.name: Benjamin Miller
posts.cooked: Thank you for the quick response. I will look into all of that.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: Multiply the gyro reading by -1 before feeding it into your heading loop.  Alternatively the gyro might have an invert method depending on what its library supports.

posts.cooked: I have done a test, and so far this proves that it works, I tried copying everything to the T

posts.name: Benjamin Miller
posts.cooked: Thank you, the final solution included inverting the turning motor in the configs file.
